name: Leopold Bloom’s Breakfast of Kidneys
description: Part of the back-story here is the link to Joyce’s character, Leopold Bloom with “which gave to his palate a fine tang of faintly scented urine”, was so acute that whenever he heard the name ‘Bloom’ he would instantly be transported to the kitchen of his grandma – a post-war ‘nothing-gets-wasted’ woman from the working class inner-city housing estate of Hyson Green in Nottingham, England.
